name: B Is for Boogie Quiz | Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: How is the alphabetical 'B' represented in Braille writing?
questions.correct: Two dots on top of the other
options: Three dots next to each other
Four dots on top of the other
questions.explanation:
Two dots on top of the other.

	In Braille writing, the alphabetical B is represented by two dots stacked on top of each other. The letter A is represented by one dot. Braille is used by people who have visual impairment.

questions.text: What artist painted the "Birth of Venus"?
questions.explanation:
Botticelli.

	Alessandro di Mariano di Vanni Filipepi was known to others as Sandro Botticelli. He was a Renaissance painter born in 1445. "Birth of Venus" is housed in the Galleria Degli Uffizi in Florence, Italy.

questions.text: Alliterative soap opera "The Bold and the Beautiful" centers on the fashion industry with the Forrester and Spectra fashion houses.
questions.explanation:
True.

	"The Bold and the Beautiful" first aired in 1987. The main three families on the series are the Forresters, Logans, and Spencers. The CBS soap opera won Outstanding Drama three years in a row at the Primetime Emmy Awards.

questions.text: Is there a state in the United States of America that begins with the letter 'B'?
questions.explanation:
No.

	No, alphabetically, the states are Alabama, Alaska, Arizona, Arkansas and then California. There is no US state beginning with the letter B.

questions.text: With this list of cities, which one of their countries would be first alphabetically: Bissex, Comilla, Nassau, Sitra?
questions.explanation:
Bahamas.

	Bahamas is the first country alphabetically by the letter 'B'. Nassau is the capital city of the Bahamas. Nassau has been the filming location for several "James Bond" movies.  Bissex is a city located in Barbados. Comilla is a city located in Bangladesh.  Sitra is a city located in Bahrain.

questions.text: Born in September 1925, Riley King is better known to the world as BB King.
questions.explanation:
True.

	BB King was born on a cotton plantation in Mississippi, USA. The name BB came from a time when he was working at WDIA and he was known as Beale Street Blues Boy. Eventually, it was shortened to BB. "Time" magazine listed BB King as the number three most famous electric guitarist of all times.

questions.text: What group loved to ride around in their "Little Deuce Coupe" and tell their "California Girls", "Don't Worry, Baby"?
questions.explanation:
Beach Boys.

	The Beach Boys began their career in 1961 in California. Brothers Carl, Dennis, and Brian Wilson joined with their cousin Mike Love and friend Al Jardine to form the Beach Boys. Their first album was with DCC records. They have made guest appearances on the shows "Home Improvement" and "Full House".

questions.text: 'B' is for boogie. How did the boogie board get its name?
options: The inventor named it after mother's maiden name
A kid suggested the name while picking his nose
The name boogie was the inventor's nickname
questions.explanation:
The inventor loved boogie music.

	Tony Morey was the inventor of the boogie board. He was a musician and worked as an engineer for an airplane company. Tony began surfing at a young age. In 1971, Tony developed the boogie board which allowed a person to lay his or her body on the board to surf. He named the board 'boogie' because of his love for that type of music.

questions.text: What does the lower case 'b' represent on a musical scale?
questions.explanation:
Flat.

	A lower case b represents a flat on a musical scale. A sharp is represented by a number sign (#) or a dièse.

questions.text: Which of these languages has the letter 'B' as the second letter in its alphabet?
questions.explanation:
Greek.

	The English alphabet begins with A and ends with Z. In Greek, the alphabet begins with Alpha and ends with Omega. Just as the letter B is second in the English alphabet, Beta is the second letter in the Greek alphabet.
